value.title: PowerApps Challenge
value.excerpt: Solved: These apps / flows are a demo of the 3 tasks mentioned in this challenge by Audrie Gordon - Challenge Details Challenge 1. A PowerApp with 2
value.content:
These apps / flows are a demo of the 3 tasks mentioned in this challenge by Audrie Gordon -

Challenge Details

 

Challenge 1. A PowerApp with 2 data sources such that the user can read the data but can't edit it.

Challenge 2. Tracking inventory of PowerApps Swag using Flow.

Challenge 3. Saving a photo to a Sharepoint Document library using Flow and adding some more meta-data to it.

watch?v=T7aLyuEwmw4


Vivek Bavishi aka That API Guy
PowerApps and Flow MVP
Blog | Twitter | YouTube | Community Profile | GitHub



If this post helps, then please consider Accept it as the solution to help the other members find it more quickly.

value.title: PowerVideo - Your own YouTube videos deck
value.excerpt: An app that helps you watch videos ONLY from the YouTube channels that you are interested in and not any algorithm recommendations. Stay focused!
value.content:
An app that helps you watch videos ONLY from the YouTube channels that you are interested in and not any algorithm recommendations. 

 

Stay focused! 

 

Install instructions -

 

Please use this github link to download all files. The App gallery doesn't allow me to upload .zip files -

https://github.com/thatapiguy/Youtube-Deck-using-PowerApps-and-Flow

Import the .zip file in PowerApps and upload the excel file in your OneDrive . Delete the exisiting OneDrive connection in the PowerApp and then add a new OneDrive connection that connects to the 'Channels' table in the spreadsheet.


Vivek Bavishi aka That API Guy
PowerApps and Flow MVP
Blog | Twitter | YouTube | Community Profile | GitHub



If this post helps, then please consider Accept it as the solution to help the other members find it more quickly.

value.title: PowerWeather Application v1.0
value.excerpt: Get your local weather in style with PowerApps and the MSN Weather connector. Features include: - Current local weather - Auto-refresh - Humidity -
value.content:
Get your local weather in style with PowerApps and the MSN Weather connector. Features include:

 

- Current local weather

- Auto-refresh

- Humidity

- Temperature

- UV Index

- Air pressure 

- Dark theme

- Google Maps as a parametized component to the application (API key needed)

 

What's left to do:

 

1. Add a component or componentized gallery to deal with sky conditions

2. Additional local weather parameters

3. Reverse Geo-code (would be super nice to have)

value.content:

movie from Twitter

Characters can be moved by dragging and dropping. If the characters overlap, the positions are swapped automatically.

value.title: Retranslator
value.excerpt: Translation apps from the app store are good. Microsoft translator has a thoughtful UI for taking turns speaking. Google Translator has a camera with
value.content:
Translation apps from the app store are good. Microsoft translator has a thoughtful UI for taking turns speaking. Google Translator has a camera with AR capabilities.

 

But one thing is missing: what is the quality of a translation? If I were to translate content, how would it actually be received? The only way to find out is to retranslate a translation.

 

This app will translate text from one language to another. Then it translates back to the original language so you can check the quality of the translation.

 

  1. Download the .msapp file.
  2. Go to Power Apps Studio.
  3. File > Open > Browse > locate the .msapp file.
  4. Replace the Microsoft Translator connector if you need to.

value.title: Shoutouts PowerApps Sample Template - With Likes - From PowerApps January 2019 Community Call
value.excerpt: The S h outouts PowerApps Sample Template, enhanced with 'Like' functionality. Watch the PowerApps Community Call from January 2019 to learn more
value.content: The Shoutouts PowerApps Sample Template, enhanced with 'Like' functionality.  Watch the PowerApps Community Call from January 2019 to learn more about this PowerApp and how to edit your Excel sheet to support the 'Like' functionality.  You can also reference this blog post where I walk through adding 'Likes' to the older version of the Shoutouts PowerApps Sample Template.

value.title: Songwriting App
value.excerpt: Hi, I have created a songwriting app! This app is you can songwriting as you like. Please see the video about how to play. This is tweet that
value.content:
Hi, I have created a songwriting app!

 

This app is you can songwriting as you like.

Please see the video about how to play.

 

This is tweet that @TAICHI  actually played!

こんな感じ！ pic.twitter.com/SJfk9wBAJp

— TAICHI (@artbreak_taichi) December 24, 2019

 

Introduce the logic of the app easily.

 

The music score is displayed by nesting collections as shown below.

If you want to adjust the length of the music score, adjust the number of records in the "score" of the collection.

 

However, keep in mind that if you make it too long, the number of records will increase proportionately, which will make your app heavier.

If you like, I'm glad if you can write and enjoy the song!

 

watch?v=w4zVCdzzQ9Y

value.title: Sound Maker
value.excerpt: It's a musical score creation & playing app. You can input 2 parts and 32 notes per part. There are the following restrictions: Possible input scales
value.content:
It's a musical score creation & playing app.

 

You can input 2 parts and 32 notes per part.

There are the following restrictions:

  • Possible input scales is between C4 to G5.
  • Sharp, flat, and dotted notes are cannot be used.
  • As playback is delayed on iOS, I recommend using it on Android or PC.

 

Play fun!

value.title: Spirograph
value.excerpt: This is a Spirograph app. It uses SVG path for creating a sense of the pattern being drawn. Huge thanks to all the community members, who have been
value.content: This is a Spirograph app. It uses SVG path for creating a sense of the pattern being drawn. Huge thanks to all the community members, who have been sharing some cool apps that helped me to learn canvas apps and Mr.Dang teaching the techniques through his videos.

value.title: Svg Shape Component
value.excerpt: This is component with svg shapes. Since there is no rotation property for any shapes in Power Apps, I have made this component to help an app
value.content:
This is component with svg shapes.

Since there is no rotation property for any shapes in Power Apps, I have made this component to help an app making.

You can set rotation angle, corner radius, color, shape type as component custom properties.

msapp file includes sample app with Properties description.

 

Any feedback is appreciated!

 

Thank you

Hiro

value.title: Swipeable Item (Component)
value.excerpt: Hi, I've made this component of an item you can swipe to the left and reveal some buttons. This component would be so nice to use in a vertical
value.content:
Hi,

I've made this component of an item you can swipe to the left and reveal some buttons.

This component would be so nice to use in a vertical Gallery (I realy hope they will implement that soon)

The component has 4 Output Properties, one for when you just click on the item, and three for whichever button you press.

There are also a lot of Input Properties for Colors, Font, Alignment... etc. Oh, and the number of buttons you want to show is configurable(from 1 to 3).

 

Please try it out, and I would love to hear your feedback

 

UPDATE v0.1:

 - Fixed Bug with slider handle on iPhone

 - Buttons will hide when not swiped far enough

 - Added version number

value.title: Throwing a Ball
value.excerpt: This app simulates the motion of throwing a ball based on concrete physics. Time development of ball is basically given by the motion of projectile
value.content:
This app simulates the motion of throwing a ball based on concrete physics.

Time development of ball is basically given by the motion of projectile with gravity and air resistance (See attached photo),  also I have implemented effects of bounce and reflection.

Equation of motionScreenshot

value.title: Time Zone Converter Demo
value.excerpt: In my 4 part video series I demonstrate how to use PowerApps, Flow and Common Data Service to convert time zones. Part 1: Creating a Flow and using
value.content:
In my 4 part video series I demonstrate how to use PowerApps, Flow and Common Data Service to convert time zones.

Time Zone Convert Demo app

  • Part 1: Creating a Flow and using the Convert Time Zone action
  • Part 2: Build the app in PowerApps
  • Part 3: Get list of time zones from CDS
  • Part 4: Connect Flow and CDS to the app in PowerApps

View the whole series here:

https://www.youtube.com/playlist?list=PLdfisYaY-FyG73gKCdXnBzhqFhRf8aUnG

value.title: Visualization of Beautiful Mathematics
value.excerpt: This app represents beautiful trajectory of circular motions of two balls. You can set period and radius of motion, and you will see the beauty of
value.content:
This app represents beautiful trajectory of circular motions of two balls.

You can set period and radius of motion, and you will see the beauty of nature

 

for a reference of background mathematics, see http://www.sci-museum.jp/files/pdf/study/research/2011/pb21_029-036.pdf

* I cdnt find English article, above is in Japanese.

 

Enjoy PowerMath!
